content:
• Thursday, March 7, 2013
  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) says that CEO J.R. Smith will step down after just a six-year tenure...

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) says that CEO J.R. Smith will step down after just a six-year tenure at the helm of the Internet and mobile-security provider. The company is currently conducting a search for his successor. Mr. Smith will remain in his role until a new CEO is found, then will become a member of the company's supervisory board after he resigns. Shares -6.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM
  • MED

    More on Medifast (NYSE:MED): Q4 beats across the board on a 20% rise in total sales Y/Y. Net...

    More on Medifast (NYSE:MED): Q4 beats across the board on a 20% rise in total sales Y/Y. Net income jumped 59% on higher direct sales. The stock is trading down in the post-session however, as the company issues downbeat guidance for Q1. It now expects to earn $0.32 cents to 35 cents on revenue of $93M to $95M. Analysts were expecting $0.45 per share on revenue of $101M. Read more on earnings here: Earnings Call Transcript. Shares -10.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 PM
  • ZQK

    More on Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ1 misses on both EPS and revenue as total sales decline by 4.1%...

    More on Quiksilver (NYSE:ZQK): FQ1 misses on both EPS and revenue as total sales decline by 4.1% Y/Y. Net earnings also declined, as bottom line performance was negatively impacted by the closure of underperforming retail stores as well as disappointing performances in its wholesale channel. Revenue from its Americas unit, the largest share of its top line, was down 9.3% and declined 2.3% in the Asia-Pacific region, while sales rose 1.4% in Europe. Shares -8.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO) says preliminary Q3 earnings are expected to be between $0.04 -...

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO) says preliminary Q3 earnings are expected to be between $0.04 - $0.06 per share, below analyst consensus of $0.09 per share. Revenues are anticipated to be $81M, also lower than estimates of $87M and below prior year revenues of $83M as well. The company blames the miss on sales attrition in its vascular access business, softness in procedure volumes in the peripheral vascular business, and delays in capital-equipment purchases that reduced oncology/surgery sales. Shares -4.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (NASDAQ:MXWL) -12.2% AH on news it's restating 2011 and 2012 results due to errors in...

    Maxwell (NASDAQ:MXWL) -12.2% AH on news it's restating 2011 and 2012 results due to errors in revenue recognition timing. Thanks to arrangements uncovered during an investigation, Maxwell "does not believe that a fixed or determinable sales price existed" for certain sales at the time of shipment, "nor was collection reasonably assured."Â  The restatement will decrease Maxwell's 2011 revenue by $6.5M, and its revenue for the first 3 quarters of 2012 by $5.5M. The company's sales/marketing chief has resigned, and "certain employees were terminated."

     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) declares $0.275/share quarterly dividend, in line with...

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) declares $0.275/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 4.04%. For shareholders of record Apr. 19. Payable May 21. Ex-div date Apr. 17. Shares -12% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • P

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: P +19%. AMBA +9%. PETS +7%. PANL +6%. RIGL +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: P +19%. AMBA +9%. PETS +7%. PANL +6%. RIGL +5%.
    After-hours top losers: MED -9%. ZQK -9%. AVG -6%. SKUL -6%. ANGO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • HRB

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ3 misses on all counts as total sales declined by 29% Y/Y....

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ3 misses on all counts as total sales declined by 29% Y/Y. Net losses also widened as a delay to the start of the U.S. tax season negatively impacted its top line. Even so, the company only deferred $15M of revenue into FQ4, which doesn't even come close to mitigating its $91.6M shortfall for the current quarter. Gross margin also narrowed to 20% from 31.4%, due to the revenue decrease. Despite the miss, optimism over a potential pickup in U.S. tax volume has the stock +3.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) guides on its Q4 call for its Q1 sales to fall 30% Y/Y - that's much...

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) guides on its Q4 call for its Q1 sales to fall 30% Y/Y - that's much worse than a consensus for a 12% increase. Shares now -6.1% AH, it looks as if some of the bad news was already priced in.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CEMI

    Chembio Diagnostics (NASDAQ:CEMI): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $7.87M (+27% Y/Y)...

    Chembio Diagnostics (NASDAQ:CEMI): Q4 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $7.87M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $0.6M. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)

    Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q4 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $31.5M (+28.3% Y/Y) beats by $2.3M. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)

  • AVG

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) CEO J.R. Smith has resigned, and will become a board member. He'll...

    AVG Technologies (NYSE:AVG) CEO J.R. Smith has resigned, and will become a board member. He'll remain at his current job until a successor is found. CC at 5PM ET (webcast) to discuss the move. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment

    YY (NASDAQ:YY): Q4 Non-GAAP ADS of $4.74. Revenue of $42.8M (+136% Y/Y). Shares -5.3% AH. (PR)

  • AMTG

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) announces a 6.8M share secondary offering, with the...

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) announces a 6.8M share secondary offering, with the underwriters granted an option for an additional 1.02M shares. The current float is 24.2M shares. Stock -2.5% to $22.11 AH. Book value as of Dec. 31 was announced last night as $22.49. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY): Q4 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $81.5M (+89% Y/Y) beats by...

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY): Q4 EPS of -$0.16 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $81.5M (+89% Y/Y) beats by $3.26M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.29 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $33.7M (+117% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM): Q4 EPS of -$0.29 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $33.7M (+117% Y/Y) beats by $1.68M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI +10.3%) steadily rallied today after announcing it has settled its patent spat with...

    Rovi (ROVI +10.3%) steadily rallied today after announcing it has settled its patent spat with Hulu; terms are undisclosed. Shares are closing at levels last seen in June '12, a couple weeks before they crashed thanks to a big Q2 warning. Rovi reaffirmed its 2013 guidance earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • IVR

    Invesco Mortgage (IVR -0.5%) continues lower following pricing of its convertible offering - 5%...

    Invesco Mortgage (IVR -0.5%) continues lower following pricing of its convertible offering - 5% coupon and exchangeable at a 15% premium to the stock's closing price yesterday. It's a sweet deal, says one trader, as it would have cost 8% to issue preferreds, and the company got a 15% premium exchange rate. Once the convertible hedgers are done selling, the stock should head back up. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR -9.7%) slides again today, this time after the company...

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR -9.7%) slides again today, this time after the company announcing late yesterday that it's filed an offering for up to $75M in stock, debt securities and warrants. The specialty pharmaceutical company plans to use proceeds for general corporate purposes. Currently, its market capitalization runs around $141M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWK

    American Water Works (AWK -1%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares to a Neutral rating earlier...

    American Water Works (AWK -1%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares to a Neutral rating earlier today on valuation. Despite the downgrade, the target price on the stock was upped to $42 from $40 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP +2.6%) settles a dispute with GSF Capital over an investment fund; GSF will exit...

    Suntech (STP +2.6%) settles a dispute with GSF Capital over an investment fund; GSF will exit the fund, leaving STP with a bigger stake. But the Chinese maker of solar panels has a convertible bond coming due next week, and whether it has the cash to pay up remains to be seen. In any case, Citigroup analysts recommend staying far away from the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ +4.2%) powers higher after hiking its dividend 19% despite mixed...

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ +4.2%) powers higher after hiking its dividend 19% despite mixed Q4 results. Despite a history of resisting JV deals that have been all the rage in the oil patch peers in recent years, CNQ says it is on the lookout for a deal to monetize about a quarter of its vast shale holdings in the Montney formation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • STX

    Hard drive kingpins Seagate (STX -2.8%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.9%) are having a rough day....

    Hard drive kingpins Seagate (STX -2.8%) and Western Digital (WDC -3.9%) are having a rough day. Pac Crest reportedly cut estimates on the companies, along with Intel and AMD, citing weak notebook sales. Hard drive controller supplier Marvell (MRVL -1.2%) is also off.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • DRQ

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +3%) is upgraded to Buy from Underperform with a $101 price target (from $83) at...

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +3%) is upgraded to Buy from Underperform with a $101 price target (from $83) at BofA, which says exploration success and crude oil prices "are set to drive at least three more years of growth in wells drilled from floating rigs," a key driver of demand for DRQ which the firm says implies accelerating earnings growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • TSLA

    A Q4 miss, high expectations, and a downgrade to Hold from Needham lead SolarCity (SCTY -13.4%)...

    A Q4 miss, high expectations, and a downgrade to Hold from Needham lead SolarCity (SCTY -13.4%) to tumble. Though expecting SolarCity to hit its 2013 deployment target of 250MW, Needham now sees less upside. On the earnings call, SolarCity mentioned it's talking with ratings agencies to lower financing costs for installations - the company recently refinanced some early debt to 3.45% from a prior 8%. Even after accounting for financing funds, SolarCity expects to burn cash over the next 3 quarters before again turning net cash flow positive. (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMD

    Cantel Medical (CMN -1%) fades off a 52-week high on profit-taking today after company posted a...

    Cantel Medical (CMN -1%) fades off a 52-week high on profit-taking today after company posted a mixed FQ2 earnings report, missing on revenue estimates. Sales hit a record however, driven by a 36% Y/Y increase from its healthcare disposables segment. Organic sales growth was 11%, about half of which was driven by distributor customers pulling forward shipments in anticipation of January 1 price increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +33%) ramp higher with no news of note out on the drug developer....

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +33%) ramp higher with no news of note out on the drug developer. Aside from a couple hiccups, the stock has been essentially dead money over the past nine sessions, following its 85% plunge last month on a voluntary recall of its anemia treatment Omontys.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • IMMR

    Midday top 10 gainers: IMMR +39%. OTC:AFFY +36%. HOTT +29%. CTC +26%. NAV +26%. GMXR +20%. REE...

    Midday top 10 gainers: IMMR +39%. OTC:AFFY +36%. HOTT +29%. CTC +26%. NAV +26%. GMXR +20%. REE +18%. HIMX +18%. CIEN +17%. MITK +17%.
    Midday top 10 losers: SCTY -14%. AV -12%. BAA -12%. HTHT -12%. YY -11%. BORN -10%. MCOX -9%. MTG -9%. BLDP -9%. JRCC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.3%) catches a bid ahead of its 1PM ET news feed announcement, which will...

    Facebook (FB +3.3%) catches a bid ahead of its 1PM ET news feed announcement, which will reportedly feature the launch of content-specific feeds. Gene Munster went on CNBC (video) this morning to declare Facebook a better growth play than Google. "Over the next 5-10 years, Google is a much more reliable play. If you're looking for more aggressive money, I'd own Facebook ... they should trade at a higher multiple than Google." Facebook currently trades at 44x 2013E EPS after backing out net cash, whereas Google trades at 15x.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • TPLM

    Coverage of Triangle Petroleum (TPLM +3.5%) is re-initiated at Outperform and $7.50 price target...

    Coverage of Triangle Petroleum (TPLM +3.5%) is re-initiated at Outperform and $7.50 price target by Imperial Capital. With vertical integration provided by investments in RockPile and Caliber Midstream, the firm believes TPLM is well positioned to develop its core Bakken acreage; a $55M infusion from Natural Gas Partners will fund a third rig to expedite the drilling program.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHK

    Burns Hargis, chairman of Chesapeake Energy's (CHK +3.4%) audit committee that conducted the...

    Burns Hargis, chairman of Chesapeake Energy's (CHK +3.4%) audit committee that conducted the probe into the financial dealings of outgoing CEO Aubrey McClendon, resigns from CHK's board. Louis Raspino, recent head of oil and gas driller Pride International, will fill the vacancy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 9 Comments
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (ICUI +0.8%) says that its family of needlefree intravenous connectors was chosen by...

    ICU Medical (ICUI +0.8%) says that its family of needlefree intravenous connectors was chosen by U.S. healthcare providers more than twice as often as any other connector technology, according to newly released FY12 data from independent research company Global Healthcare Exchange. Separately, Piper Jaffray intiates the shares with an Overweight and a $70 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.9%) and Ericsson (ERIC +3.4%) have joined the rally seen in telecom...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.9%) and Ericsson (ERIC +3.4%) have joined the rally seen in telecom equipment and optical component makers following Ciena's market-pleasing results and guidance. This morning, Ericsson, which has an early lead in 4G deployments, announced a 4G infrastructure deal with MetroPCS - merger partner T-Mobile USA (OTCQX:DTEGY) reportedly plans to flip the switch on its LTE network later this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.3%) says the challenges of developing North America’s...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.3%) says the challenges of developing North America’s first major chromite mine are finally on the verge of being overcome. A feasibility study which would help attract a partner to share capital costs and risk will be completed later this year, and progress is being made in First Nations talks. Still a holdup: a definitive agreement with Ontario's government.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • MNK

    Cadence Pharmaceutical (CADX +2%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates across the board. Total...

    Cadence Pharmaceutical (CADX +2%) moves up after beating Q4 estimates across the board. Total revenue rose over 180% Y/Y, driven by higher licensing revenue driven by it's data license agreement with Terumo Corporation. Terumo intends to seek regulatory approval in Japan for the same intravenous formulation of acetaminophen as CADX's Ofirmev.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • APA

    Apache's (APA +3.2%) potential sale of its Gulf of Mexico deepwater assets, combined with last...

    Apache's (APA +3.2%) potential sale of its Gulf of Mexico deepwater assets, combined with last month's announced intention to sell $2B worth of assets, would help its debt reduction goals, Tudor Pickering Holt analysts say. APA has interests in more than 150 oil blocks in the deepwater Gulf encompassing ~900K gross acres.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +5.1%) extends yesterday's big gains as Credit Suisse upgrades shares to...

    Petrobras (PBR +5.1%) extends yesterday's big gains as Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $25 price target, believing the move to raise diesel prices may be the beginning of a change in attitude and the company may have hit an "inflection point."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • GPS

    More on Gap (NYSE:GPS): A vendor for the company released a transcript covering its pre-recorded...

    More on Gap (NYSE:GPS): A vendor for the company released a transcript covering its pre-recorded sales call early leading to a quick 4% runup in shares before trading was halted. The company just released its full sales report. Shares have now resumed trading up 3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +3.4%) rallies ahead of the release of the NTSB's report, earlier hitting its highest...

    Boeing (BA +3.4%) rallies ahead of the release of the NTSB's report, earlier hitting its highest level since June 2008, and accounting for roughly one-third of the DJIA's current gain today. Separately, the company issued an update on its Orders & Deliveries page today with 27 new orders: ALC 10 777s, GECAS four 737s, Qantas five 737s, and United Airlines eight 737s. In the Changes category, 737 net orders were reduced by two.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (GPS +4.1%) have been halted with news pending.

    Shares of Gap (GPS +4.1%) have been halted with news pending.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • GPS

    Gap (GPS +4.1%) says total sales during February rose 11% to $966M. The retailer's global...

    Gap (GPS +4.1%) says total sales during February rose 11% to $966M. The retailer's global comparable-store sales were up 3% Y/Y in February with a 6% gain at Old Navy helping to offset a sluggish month for Banana Republic. Following a familiar retail theme, Gap says sales came in stronger at the end of the month as winter storms abated. (sales call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • BAA

    Gold miner Banro (BAA -10%) is looking for a new President and CEO, as Simon Village steps down...

    Gold miner Banro (BAA -10%) is looking for a new President and CEO, as Simon Village steps down from both roles effective immediately; John Clarke will become interim CEO. In an update on operations in the Congo, BAA says its Twangiza plant expansion continues as planned and Namoya construction is on schedule for Q4 completion.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • MLNX

    An upgrade to Outperform from JMP is giving Mellanox (MLNX +4.2%) a boost; the firm has set a PT...

    An upgrade to Outperform from JMP is giving Mellanox (MLNX +4.2%) a boost; the firm has set a PT of $70. Mellanox has been mostly range-bound since Jan. 3, when it crashed thanks to its Q4 warning. Yesterday, Mellanox announced its InfiniBand adapter cards and switches are used in a high-end SQL Server data warehousing system developed by Microsoft, and offered by H-P and Dell.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • SNOA

    Shares of Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS -22%) get hammered after pricing a 7.5M share...

    Shares of Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS -22%) get hammered after pricing a 7.5M share offering at $0.40, a 25% discount to yesterday's closing price. The company announced its intention to offer stock after yesterday's close, but didn't detail the number of shares or the price. The commercial healthcare company currently has around 37.4M shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) crumbles 11.4% after its Q4 EPS miss and earnings call...

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) crumbles 11.4% after its Q4 EPS miss and earnings call (slides), which one Yahoo poster describes as disappointing, as "execs seemed confused, analysts unhappy." Net loss widens to $16.8M from $12.7M, primarily due to increased trial costs. As of Feb 28, Celldex had liquidity of $189M following a $114.1M fundraising. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • VIAV

    It's rally time for telecom equipment and optical component makers, as the Street sees positive...

    It's rally time for telecom equipment and optical component makers, as the Street sees positive implications in Ciena's FQ1 beat and respectable FQ2 guidance for service provider capex. JDSU +6.2%. JNPR +4%. FNSR +4.5%. INFN +5.1%. ADTN +2.5%. RVBD +1.7%. FFIV +2.3%. CALX +2.1%. OCLR +5.7%. OPLK +2.7%. EXFO +4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +15.4%) pop after the company hires a new CEO and issues slightly...

    Shares of Navistar (NAV +15.4%) pop after the company hires a new CEO and issues slightly better-than-expected results for Q4. Though part of today's wild action could be a weeding out of shorts, if nothing else the commentary from Navistar seems to confirm a recent report on strengthening in the trucking sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • KR

    Kroger (KR +3.2%) trades higher after its Q4 report delivers some surprise to the upside....

    Kroger (KR +3.2%) trades higher after its Q4 report delivers some surprise to the upside. Revenue at comparable stores rose a respectable 3% and operating expenses dropped 70 bps compared to last year. The company says it expects FY13 EPS of $2.71 to $2.79.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • SD

    Canaccord cuts its price target for SandRidge Energy (SD -2%) to a measly $1, citing SD's 2013...

    Canaccord cuts its price target for SandRidge Energy (SD -2%) to a measly $1, citing SD's 2013 capital plan and associated capital productivity which embeds $500M-$600M in JV carries vs. prior expectations of $300M-$400M. Meanwhile, responding to a letter from TPG-Axon, CEO Tom Ward tells employees SD's outlook has never been better. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +26%) skies higher after striking a multi-year licensing deal with Samsung for...

    Immersion (IMMR +26%) skies higher after striking a multi-year licensing deal with Samsung for its basic haptic effects IP.
